TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void XmlElementEventHandler(object sender, XmlElementEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed XmlElementEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that handles the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnknownElement> event of an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create an XmlElementEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that handles the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnknownElement> event occurs only when you call the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize%2A> method.
## Examples The following example deserializes a class named `Group` from a file named UnknownElements.xml. Whenever an element is found in the file that has no corresponding member in the class, the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnknownElement> event occurs. To try the example, paste the following XML code into a file named UnknownElements.xml.
``` <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <Group xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <GroupName>MyGroup</GroupName> <GroupSize>Large</GroupSize> <GroupNumber>444</GroupNumber> <GroupBase>West</GroupBase> </Group> ```
[!code-cs[XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.xml.serializati_11_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.xml.serializati_11_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.xml.serializati_11_1.vb)]
